page.title: 17Landscape around Brafferton
page.content: The area is a predominantly rural one with a long history of established farming. Accordingly the main features visible to the visitor are the fields averaging between 15 and 30 acres in size and divided from each other by quickthorn hedges or fencing. The area is generally low lying and gently undulating with small hills, usually capped by a farm, dominating the landscape. In spite of the farming activity, the land has a surprising amount of tree cover still in place particularly along the numerous streams that criss-cross the area. The predominant colour in the landscape is green, of the trees, grass or the fodder crops grown for the dairy and beef cattle raised here. There is some yellow from the oil seed rape but only on a small scale.
